headline: Got $3,000? 3 Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stocks to Buy and Hold for the Long Term.
summary: Broadcom is making custom artificial intelligence (AI) accelerators for several tech companies, including Alphabet and Meta Platforms.  Alphabet has incorporated AI tech throughout its businesses, and shares are affordably priced right now.  ASML manufactures machines that are crucial to semiconductor production.

headline: The AI Trade Is Back. This ETF Shows Why.
summary: The AI trade is back, if the GlobalX Artificial Intelligence & Technology exchange-trade fund is any indication.  The ETF has 85 component stocks, ranging from  Tencent Holdings  which comprises 3.9% of the fund, down to  Soundhound  AI, which makes up just 0.2%.

headline: Oil prices & defense stocks fall, Broadcom upgraded to Buy
summary: Here are stories Wall Street is watching on Tuesday, June 24. Stocks (^DJI, ^GSPC, ^IXIC) are trading higher while oil prices (CL=F) are falling on hopes that tensions between Iran and Israel are cooling. Those hopes are also sending shares of defense stocks lower. Broadcom (AVGO) is trading higher after being upgraded to Buy from Hold at HSBC. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Arm Reaches For New Highs After Laying Groundwork For The AI Revolution
summary: An unsung hero in the artificial intelligence revolution is a relatively small U.K. chip design company called Arm Holdings.  On Tuesday, Arm stock got a Relative Strength Rating upgrade that pushed its stock into an elite group.  Arm designs chip cores and licenses them to makers of the microprocessors that run electronic devices.

headline: Buy Broadcom Stock, HSBC Says. Its AI Chip Prospects Are Improving.
summary: Broadcom  stock is an attractive buying opportunity, even after its rally this year, according to HSBC.  On Tuesday, analyst Frank Lee raised his rating for the company’s stock to Buy from Hold and increased his price target to $400 from $240.  Broadcom’s semiconductors compete in several categories, including networking, broadband, server storage, wireless, and industrial.
